metadata.synopsis: Always looking for action, five over-enthusiastic but under-stimulated Vermont State Troopers raise hell on the highway, keeping motorists anxiously looking in their rear-view mirrors. Between an ongoing feud with the local cops over whose you-know-what is bigger, and the state government wanting to shut them down, the "Super Troopers" find themselves precariously and hilariously heading toward calamity as they try to avoid extinction.

reviews: It's become somewhat of a cult comedy with a faithful fan base, despite containing almost no sequences that are laugh-out-loud funny or memorably unique.
Sex and drug jokes abound in lowbrow comedy.
Tears out at a refreshingly reckless pace, then gradually settles into a law-abiding speed. [Blu-ray]
...doesn't have enough plot or successful jokes to keep it afloat.
Filme amalucado, mas com grande esprito de diverso.  incrvel que o filme consiga estabelecer tamanha empatia por seus heris, j que estes so imbecis e s fazem besteira.
The movie is as juvenile and silly as it looks. But it's also funnier than you would expect.
This is one of those films that makes movie critics embarassed to admit they liked it without first smoking a joint.
If the shots were more focused and the sound design had a little more punch, this could be an amazing film instead of just an endearing one.
Comedy troupe Broken Lizard's first movie is very funny but too concerned with giving us a plot.
This seemingly endless sitcom is too infatuated with its own hijinks to realize they're virtually witless.
The movie's mostly a succession of predictable skits, leavened only by the occasional amusing one-liner and played by actors who aren't actors so much as just a bunch of guys goofing off.
